result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Sexual Intercourse with Child 16 or Older, Actor 19 or Older

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua L Kirk

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

BOND TO COVER 22CM520 & 22CM521

Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH J.R.C. dob 10-4-2004, NO UNSUPERVISED CONTACT WITH MINORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant Joshua L Kirk in court.  Attorney Joshua Ryan-Polczinski in court for Joshua L Kirk.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Reading of complaint waived. Not guilty plea entered by counsel and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
